body: So recently, I've been seeing lots of staff saying "Please don't bump old topics". I think I know what a bump is, but correct me if I'm wrong. Isn't it when you bring an old topic back up? I don't understand why we can't do that. As long as it's on topic of the thread, why can't we talk about it?
body_tagged: So recently, I've been seeing lots of staff saying "Please don't bump old topics". I think I know what a bump is, but correct me if I'm wrong. Isn't it when you bring an old topic back up? I don't understand why we can't do that. As long as it's on topic of the thread, why can't we talk about it?
title: "Bumping threads"

replies.body: Well you can, what you bump with has to be on topic and not just some random thing like the user Blueish showed everyone. If you see an old topic read the post then reply but really you don't HAVE to reply on old topics. Some topics just don't need anymore replys.
replies.body_tagged: Well you can, what you bump with has to be on topic and not just some random thing like the user Blueish showed everyone. If you see an old topic read the post then reply but really you don't HAVE to reply on old topics. Some topics just don't need anymore replys.

replies.body: Your bumps are like useless. There's no point in bumping them
replies.body_tagged: Your bumps are like useless. There's no point in bumping them

replies.body:
A bump is usually a post on a very old topic that is either irrelevant/spammy or better suited for another topic/place.

Most of the time either the thread is irrelevant or the posts do not contribute much to the thread.
replies.body_tagged:
A bump is usually a post on a very old topic that is either irrelevant/spammy or better suited for another topic/place.

Most of the time either the thread is irrelevant or the posts do not contribute much to the thread.

replies.body: You didn't have to bump dawson's topic. Seriously, you know he's back and you don't need to say welcome back 2 months later on a thread.
replies.body_tagged: You didn't have to bump dawson's topic. Seriously, you know he's back and you don't need to say welcome back 2 months later on a thread.

replies.body:
Bumps are only allowed if the comment in question is on topic.
If a bump is completely off topic that is when the topic gets locked.
As long as the comment is relevant to the OP, it's completely fine.

The staff need to be more specific when locking topics to avoid this type of confusion.
This wasn't a problem a while ago...staff used to be quite specific when locking threads.
replies.body_tagged:
Bumps are only allowed if the comment in question is on topic.

As long as the comment is relevant to the OP, it's completely fine.

The staff need to be more specific when locking topics to avoid this type of confusion.
This wasn't a problem a while ago...staff used to be quite specific when locking threads.

replies.body:
In theory yes.
But it's very unlikely that such a popular thread will be dormant for such a long time.

Also, considering it's one of Avicus' main threads, I would assume that the off-topic post would just be archived, with the player getting warned and everything going back to normal.
I doubt the staff are that ignorant to just straight up lock it..like, why lock the face thread because of one person's off-topic bump? Just archive the post.

replies.body:
I guess not.

Generally threads with a higher view count are less likely to encounter idle periods, meaning that something like is won't happen often.

This was simply my assumption, if I were the staff member I would just archive the post and leave it as that.
Considering players only get verbal warnings for first-time offenses it should be fine,

But you're right, all threads should be treated equally when Moderating, just like how all players should be treated equally when Moderating.
